sentences.en: Qinhui was a notorious sycophantic official in the Song dynasty, and was spurned by later generations.
sentences.cn: 秦桧是宋代著名的佞臣, 受尽后人的唾骂.
好溜须拍马的新闻记者

sentences.en: The trusty had a silly, sycophantic manner of raising one hand in salute.
sentences.cn: 这个好囚犯用一种愚蠢的, 拍马的态度举起一只手行礼.

sentences.en: We heard the sound of sycophantic laughter.
sentences.cn: 我们听到了谄媚的笑声。

trans.tran_en: praising important or powerful people too much because you want to get something from them – used in order to show disapproval
